author: Louise
text:
I have been a buyer for a few years (and I spend a lot!) I am tired of the endless cancelled sales and sometimes wait weeks for a refund, tying up my credit card funds, in November 2021 I had over 11.5k of outstanding refunds from cancelled sales, this month 4.5k so far! Your free shipping credits or promotion vouchers disappear and are lost with cancelled sales. Offers regularly don't work.
I tried selling, which was an even worse experience. My first item was rejected for one very minor crease on the leather (we are selling second hand goods here). Yet I received an item a day later which had serious non-photographed or described defects (theres no consistency). Today another item rejected because the UK hub can't confirm authenticity! Its obviously authentic, I have been buying and selling Chanel for years I know my stuff. Its insulting and now I have to pay (by bank transfer) to get my authentic item back which can take up to 14 days! Yet fakes are uploaded on a daily basis (supposedly vetted before going live) What a waste of everyone's time.
title: POOR PLATFORM FOR BOTH BUYERS AND SELLERS!

author: yeung mimi
text: I feel hopefulness, disappointed and shocked. I was sold a pair of Vintage Dior earrings, they requested its'  receipt but I bought it at Japan Dior store such a really long time ago as a vintage style like more than 10 years, may I ask how to keep a small amount little sheet for so long??? They don't know how to clarify it then their team said the item was not compliant. At this moment, they keep my earrings for more than half years now and still suck at their "hub" because they request me to pay them a process fees, so ridiculous? text:

author: Margarita
text:
SCAM - ZERO STARS - STAY AWAY FROM THIS SITE!! TOTALLY UNETHICAL BUSINESS. CHECK THE REVIEWS BEFORE BUYING. 
Like many others below, I've had the worst experience and shall never buy from them again. Please read before buying: 
- Bought a vintage YSL bag and paid for the authentication process, total €412. The bag was delivered on December 11th. I used it once before Xmas and then not again until late December due to travels. The second time I used it (I was wearing light coloured clothes), I saw some very noticeable stains on my camel coat and grey jumper. I rubbed a white paper on the bag to make sure it was the bag staining before reaching out to VC. 
- I made contact on the 6th of January (outside of the return window which is 14 days according T&Cs) and was told I would get a response in 24h. Silence. After 2 chase emails, somebody gets back to me on the 10th asking when the item was delivered, which they could have checked their end, but okay. 
- From here, I was asked to provide photos of the damaged clothing and the bag. I sent photos of the stained jumper (the coat was washed and the stain came off). I also sent 2 videos of me rubbing a white paper on the bag to prove it does stain. 
- Solution from VC is: sorry you've had a problem but because you're outside of the return window, the only thing we can do is offer you to re-list the product at no cost for you. In other words, become the seller of a faulty product that damages clothes and then assume the risk yourself. 
- they have now told me 3 times to re-list. After I tell them I do not accept this solution, they keep copying and pasting the same reply over and over. Also don't reply to the WhatsApp 'helpline'. 
- As VC refused to provide an acceptable solution, I had to resort to contacting the seller via leaving a message on the original listing. The seller very kindly said she would help via VC. She messaged me yesterday to say she was trying to help but VC told her that there is nothing to do, that I must re-list the bag. WHAT THE HELL!!! 
- So to sum up: 1) VC is not taking responsibility for their clearly faulty authentication process 2) they're asking me to pass on the problem to someone else 3) they're asking me to list and wait an undetermined period of time until I sell it/if I sell it to recover what I paid for and potentially make a loss 4) alternative is for me to keep a €400 product that will ruin my clothes 5) Am I being penalised for having worn dark clothing the first time I used the bag and not noticing the issue? How is it logical to have to check for staining on a vintage bag when there's been a paid for authentication process? 6) they are stopping the seller from providing a solution which she is willing to do. 

I understand I'm out of the 14 day window but this is not a solution at all. Zero lux experience. 

This company's sole goal is to take the buyer's money, this is where their interest ends. From here, once you have an issue, you're on your own. 

I shall report this problem to the ombudsman due to the lack of solution from VC.
title: SCAM - ZERO STARS - STAY AWAY FROM THIS SITE!! TOTALLY UNETHICAL BUSINESS. CHECK THE REVIEWS BEFORE BUYING.

author: DrLynda AN
text:
The items on this site are good however, the customer service is useless. I ordered an item from Italy to be sent to a aramex shop and ship address which has to saved in my address book on their site. There is no option to put the address when checking out it automatically picks up the address from your saved addresses then shows you where the item will be delivered. Instead of sending my item to the saved address they sent it to a collection point in Italy and despite spending hours between the customer service on vestiaire and UPS I could not retrieve or reroute the item. Vestiare insisted I gave them that drop of address which is ridiculous as I live in the middle east so clearly I would not give them a n address to pick it up myself. Until now I am still waiting to see if the item will reach back to the sender. Then today a second incident happened exactly the same scenario, I gave them my Aramex shop and ship address in France only to receive an email from Vestiare again telling me I have to go and collect it from a drop of point! I tried to get sense out of the person on the chat line who basically said I have to find someone in France to collect it for me then ended the chat.
£700 pounds has now gone out of my account for items I have not received and the process to make a claim is a joke. I just pray the items reach back to the sender for me to get a refund!
Apart from that there was also two occasions when I ordered something and paid for it only to wait a week to be told the item is no longer available and them had to wait for a refund.
Very very bad business model. While the principle is great I've not had a single good experience with this company and would not recommend them.

author: Amanda Ack
text:
I purchased a wallet on Vestiaire Collective that was described by the seller as unused. It went through Vestiaire Collective's "authentication" process. When I received the wallet, it absolutely reeked of perfume and had clearly visible scratches on the hardware. I contacted Vestiaire Collective to request a return, since the item I received did not match the seller's description. In response, they offered me a promo code for 11.945 euro. This is shockingly poor customer service! I let them know that this was not an acceptable resolution and that I would open a dispute with PayPal if necessary. I am well within my rights for a refund, since the item I received was obviously not as the seller described. Avoid Vestiaire Collective!

Update #1: After I told them I'd file a PayPal dispute if necessary, they agreed to recheck the item. They provided a return shipping label (although it wasn't added to my account immediately - I had to ask them about it). We'll see what happens.

Update #2: They rechecked the item and determined that I was correct about its condition - I received a full refund. While I'm pleased with this outcome, I still won't shop with Vestiaire Collective again. I shouldn't have to threaten a company with a PayPal dispute to get them to adhere to their own terms and conditions.
title: Appalling customer service. Do not do business with this company.
